moves.1. b4 Nf6 2. Bb2 Nc6: My favourite opening. This is the standard response from black.
moves.3. b5 Na5: Forcing the knight to the edge of the board. The game is still being played by the book.
moves.4. d4: Trying to grab some control over the centre.
moves.7. f3: Preparing for e4. Usually I wouldn't move the weak spot but I don't feel threatened by his bishops orqueen so I feel comfortable in playing it.
moves.7... Ne3 8. Nh3 Bh6: Both sides continuing to develop pieces.
moves.10... Bxc2: Plays with bishop insted to make sure that it is safe from the e2 f3 g4 pawn chain.
moves.13... Qd7 14. Ng5: I get a nice little outpost for my knight. Nc2 is staring him right in the face. Why won't he play it? All comments welcome.
moves.14... Ng8 15. h4: I'm a little bit worried about the h3 square. That's why I play this move. Just to get another defender.
moves.16. Kd1 Nxa1 17. Qxa1: We are level in terms of material now.
moves.17... Nf6: Brings his knighty back into the game. Why did he move it in the first place? I thought he was trying to force the knight to retreat. But he never played f6. He's probably still wary about e4.
moves.18. e4: The black queen could blast straight through to my king if I'm not careful.
moves.18... dxe4 19. fxe4: We swap. I have full central control now.
moves.19... Nxe4: He takes. Interesting move. I wouldn't have played it.
moves.20. Ngxe4 Bxe4 21. Nxe4: I win a piece but lose a pawn. I think I'm on top easily with my position.
moves.21... Qg4+: Ah, I see why he played Nxe4 now. He goes up a pawn.
moves.22. Be2 Qxe4 23. Re1: Everything is coming together for me now. I have an almost free passage straight to his king.
moves.23... Qd5 24. Bg4: All my pieces are in position now. Time to begin the siege.
moves.25... Kd8: If he had of played f8 I would have played Re5 check and win his queen.
moves.26. Qc3: Threatening checkmate. Ignoring the threat on the bishop.
moves.26... Rc8: To be expected. If anyone sees a better move that he could have played please comment.
moves.27. Bf3: Forcing the queen away. The queen can't do anything to defend his king now. I also win his rook with this move as well.
moves.27... Qg8 28. Bxb7: Everything is in place now. Time to finish him off.
moves.29. Bxc5 Qa2: His queen prepares to throw in a few useless checks.
moves.30. Bxc8: Not caring about his queen I take his rook.
moves.31. Kd2 Qa2+ 32. Kc1: He can't check me without losing his queen now.
moves.33... Qxb5 34. Qc7#: And gameover. I hope you enjoyed watching this game. I can tell you I certainly enjoyed playing it.
